legendary.name: Call Chort (1/Day)
entries: The crone summons 1 chort. A summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the crone, and acts as an ally of its crone. It remains for 1 minute, until it or its crone dies, or until the crone dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crone's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18). The crone can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger. Verdant Blessing. The AC of the dryad includes her Charisma bonus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dryad makes two attacks.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 18 ({@dice 3d8+5}) damage of one of the following types (dryad's choice): acid, cold, fire, lightning or poison.

action.name: Verdant Ward (2/Day)
entries: A ward of green shimmering energy forms around the dryad. The dryad gains 50 temporary hit points. While she has these temporary hit points, the dryad has resistance to damage from spells. If the dryad takes force damage she loses all her temporary hit points, ending the ward.

legendary.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: The dryad makes one elemental bolt attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dryad casts a spell, using a daily use as normal.

legendary.name: Eternal Slumber (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dryad targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed and fall unconscious into a state of suspended animation. Time ceases to flow for it, and it doesn't grow older. The curse has no effect on undead or constructs. The curse lasts until it is lifted by a remove curse spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Verdant Touch (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The dryad touches another creature. The target magically regains 23 ({@dice 4d8+5}) hit points and is freed from any charm, curse, disease, poison or petrification effect.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 18). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Wood Aspect
entries: As a bonus action at the start of her turn, the spriggan can magically shapeshift into a wood aspect. The wood aspect lasts until the spriggan is incapacitated or choose to end it. While transformed, the spriggan gains one of the following benefits of her choice:
Birch: Whenever the spriggan casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, she can cast it using a bonus action instead.
Oak: The spriggan's AC becomes 19 and she has resistance to bludgeoning and piercing damage.
Willow: The spriggan is invisible and leaves no physical evidence of her passage unless she wishes to. Tracking her is impossible except by magical means.

trait.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: The spriggan is considered to be both a fey and a plant creature to determine the way a spell or effect would affect her.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The spriggan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The spriggan can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the spriggan can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spriggan makes three attacks.

action.name: Reaching Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 12 ({@dice 2d8+3}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@dice 3d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.

action.name: Thorns Volley
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, range 90/180 ft., one target. Hit: 9 ({@dice 3d4+3}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@dice 3d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries: The spriggan magically animates one or two trees she can see within 60 feet of her. These trees have the same statistics as an awakened tree. An animated tree acts as an ally of the spriggan. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the spriggan dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the spriggan takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spriggan's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The spriggan can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The dryad can use her action to polymorph into a Medium beautiful female elf., or back into her true form. Her statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. She reverts to her true form if she dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dryad makes two attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 7 ({@dice 1d8+3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@dice 2d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 ({@dice 1d6+3}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@dice 2d8}) poison damage.

reaction.name: Tree Merge
entries: In response to another creature dealing damage to the dryad, the dryad reduces the damage to 0 by stepping magically into one living tree and emerge in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the tree. To do so, the dryad must see the attacker and have a Large or bigger tree within her reach. If the dryad takes fire damage or damage from a silvered weapon, this trait doesn't function until the end of the dryad's next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The drowner has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Drowning Aura
entries: Any living, breathing creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the drowner must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature begins to drown and is restrained. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a failure, the target drops to 0 hit points. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the drowned dead's Drowning Aura for the next 24 hours. Amphibious creatures are not affected.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned dead makes two claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ({@dice 2d6+3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the drowner can grapple the target (escape DC 13).

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker hits the drowned dead with an attack it can use his reaction to half the damage, provided it isn't blinded and deafened.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The drowner has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the drowner's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 ({@dice 2d4+2}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the drowner can grapple the target (escape DC 12).

action.name: Drag Under
entries: The drowner can drag in deep waters or mud a grappled, incapacitated, paralyzed or stunned target. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or take 8 ({@dice 2d6+1}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone and buried in mud. The buried target is restrained and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature can take an action to make a DC 10 Strength check, ending the buried state on a success.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The raider can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The northlander is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Battleaxe or Longsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Wall of Shields
entries: When the raider is within 5 feet of a creature that has the Mariner trait and is bearing a shield, it can use their reaction to make a wall of shields. The involved raider and creature gain half cover, provided they are bearing a shield.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The warrior can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The warrior is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the warrior can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d12+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Boarding Harpoon
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 12) and pulled 10 feet toward the warrior. If this bring the grappled creature within 5 feet of the warrior, the warrior can make a melee weapon attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The maiden can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of her turns.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The maiden can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The maiden is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Javelin
entries: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature misses the maiden with a melee weapon attack, the maiden can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the creature

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the huskarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Deadly Strike (1/Turn)
entries: Any hit with a melee weapon attack the huskarl scores against a prone creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The huskarl can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The huskarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The huskarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The huskarl makes either three melee attacks - two with its longsword and one with its spiked shield - or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: Spiked Shield
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Bulwark
entries: When an ally the huskarl can see within 5 feet of it is attacked, the huskarl switches places with the ally. The two ally swap places, and the huskarl becomes the target instead.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The skald has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The skald can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The skald is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Shout of Valor (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The skald can utter a powerful warcry. For 1 minute, whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a damage roll. The creature can add a d6 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the skald. A creature can benefit from only one Shout of Valor die at a time. This effect ends if the skald is incapacitated or frightened.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skald makes two melee attacks or two ranged attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) piercing damage.

action.name: War Horn (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The skald blows in its horn. Each hostile creature within 120 feet of the skald that can hear it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the skald's next turn or until the skald is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within 30 feet of the skald must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the skald as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the safest available route away from the skald. A target that successfully saves is immune to the War Horn of all skalds for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Lore Keeper
entries: The volva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The volva can hold her breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The volva is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Seeress
entries: The volva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the volva is incapacitated or restrained. While the volva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

Wand-Wed. The volva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the volva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a volva can use the staff.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (ld6-1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (ld8-1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tormenting Vision
entries: The volva targets one creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target is under one of the following effects, chosen by the volva:
The target takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage and is frightened until the end of the volva's next turn.

On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
The target falls unconscious until the end of its next turn. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the berserker hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Islander's Fortitude (2/Day)
entries: If damage reduces the berserker to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the berserker drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The berserker can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The berserker is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the berserker is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the berserker can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts for 1 minute or until the berserker is incapacitated. While raging, the berserker gains the following benefits:
The berserker has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the berserker gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.
The berserker has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Retaliation
entries: In response to being hit by a melee attack, the berserker can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against the attacker.

reaction.name: Intimidating Presence
entries: When a creature the berserker can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the berserker, the berserker can intimidate it. If the creature can see the berserker, it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of berserker's next turn.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the thane hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The thane can reroll a saving throw it fails. It must use the new roll.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The thane can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The thane is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Martial Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: The thane can deal an extra 17 (5d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the thane can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thane makes three melee attacks: one with its battleaxe and two with its longsword.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) slashing damage. If the thane scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The thane makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

legendary.name: Inspire Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, the creature gains 20 temporary hit points.

legendary.name: Rally Ally
entries: The thane targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the thane, it is freed from any charm and fright effect.

legendary.name: Rush (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The thane moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and slams into it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or take 14 (2d8+5) bludgeoning damage and be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

trait.name: First Axe
entries: A weapon deals two extra dice of its damage when the jarl hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The jarl can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The jarl is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The jarl regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jarl makes three melee attacks or three ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8+5) slashing damage. If the jarl scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

action.name: Javelin
entries: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6+5) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The jarl adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the jarl must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

legendary.name: Marked for Death
entries: The jarl targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The next attack roll made against this target before the end of the jarl's next turn has advantage.

legendary.name: Deathblow (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The jarl makes one weapon attack. If it hits, the attack deals maximum damage and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Unleash the Fury (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Up to three friendly creature within 120 feet of the jarl that can hear it can use their reactions to move up to their speed and each make one weapon attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Ancestor's Protection
entries: The heir has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the heir. If the heir's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the heir is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the heir, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the heir hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The heir's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Mariner
entries: The heir can hold its breath underwater for twice as long and has proficiency with navigator's tools. The heir is also naturally adapted to cold climates, as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the heir is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

trait.name: Unbridled Rage
entries: As a bonus action, the heir can enter a rage at the start of its turn. The rage lasts until the heir is incapacitated or choose to end it. While raging, the heir gains the following benefits:
The heir has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, the heir gains a +4 bonus to the damage roll.
The heir has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The heir makes two melee attacks or four melee attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining. On a hit, the heir can cause an additional effect, choosing from the options below (each effect can be used only once per turn):
The attack deals an extra 18 (4d8) slashing damage.
The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the northlander's next turn.
The attack bypass the damage resistances of the target.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d12+7) slashing damage.

monster.name: Shade Host
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Swarm
entries: The shade host can occupy another creature's space and vice versa; it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The shade host can't gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Howling Hatred
entries: The shade host emits a horrific howl while it can see any living creature and isn't incapacitated. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the shade host and can hear the howl must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the end of its next turn.

While frightened in this way, the creature rolls a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature drops whatever it is holding and must move at least 30 feet away from the shade host, if able. On a 5 or 6, the creature is stunned until the start of its next turn. On a 7 or 8, the creature is overwhelmed with despair until the start of its next turn. During this time, it can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade host can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shade Host Weaknesses
entries: The shade host has the following flaws:
Repelled by Salt: The shade host can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity: The shade host takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade host makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (4d8+3) necrotic damage.

action.name: Create Specter
entries: The shade host targets a humanoid within its space that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target's spirit rises as a specter that becomes part of the shade host, the shade host regains 22 (5d8) hit points. While the specter is part of the shade host, the dead humanoid it came from can't be revived.

monster.name: Shade

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The shade can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Creatures within 5 feet of the shade can't regain hit points.

trait.name: Shadow Shroud
entries: As a bonus action, the shade magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to a space it can see. It can also turn invisible until it attacks, either before or after it teleports. If the shade takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of the shade's next turn.

trait.name: Shade Weaknesses
entries: The shade has the following flaws:

Repelled by Salt: The shade can't willingly pass a line of salt by nonmagical means. If the shade tries to use teleportation to do so, it must first succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. Whether or not the attempt is successful, the shade takes 9 (2d8) radiant damage.
Sunlight Hypersensitivity: The shade takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shade makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Annihilating Touch
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8+3) necrotic damage. If the shade had advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Pesta

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Deceitful Mask
entries: As a bonus action, the wraith can mask its appearance and appear to be any kind of ghost, specter or wraith. In addition, the wraith changes the way it appears to spells and magical effects that detect creature types, such as a paladin's Divine Sense. It chooses a creature type and other spells and magical effects treat it as if it were a creature of that type or of that alignment. This magical illusion lasts until it ends it as a bonus action. The effect also ends if the wraith drops to 50 hit points or fewer, or if dispel magic is cast on it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wraith regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the wraith takes radiant damage this trait doesn't function at the start of the wraith's next turn.

trait.name: Supernatural Plague
entries: The wraith contains all diseases that ever existed, aggravated by its nature. All are magical diseases and affect creatures immune to nonmagical disease. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic casted on a creature affected with a disease of the wraith can remove it only if the caster succeeds on a DC 15 ability check using its spellcasting ability.

action.name: Plague Caress
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw, its hit point maximum is reduced for 1 hour by an amount equal to the necrotic damage it took. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature's hit point maximum to return to normal before that time passes.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith uses one of the following breath weapons:

Plague Breath: The wraith exhales a 60-foot cone of flies and pests. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become infected with a disease. This plague ravages an infected creature's body, killing the creature in a number of hours equal to 1d12+the creature's Constitution score, unless the disease is removed.

Poison Breath: The wraith exhales a 60-foot cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 56 (16d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Affliction
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is infected with a disease. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. A humanoid slain by this attack rises as an undead at the start of its next turn. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 Hit Dice or more, it becomes a rotfiend.

legendary.name: Vermin Cloud (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith releases a cloud of insects that fills a 15-foot radius sphere centered on itself. The cloud lingers until the end of the wraith's next turn. The cloud is opaque. Any creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 24 hours.

monster.name: Oracula

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Catoptric Travel
entries: When the wraith is within 5 feet of a reflective surface that it can see, it can use a bonus action to shift to the Material Plane, the Ethereal Plane, or its demiplane. When it would enter the Ethereal Plane, it can instead immediately appear in front of a different reflective surface that it can see in the Material Plane if that mirror is within 60 feet of it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mirror Bound
entries: On the Material Plane, the wraith can only move within the span of reflection of reflective surfaces, such as mirrors, still pools, and polished steel, that are at least a square foot. If it is more than 30 feet away from any such surface, the wraith immediately shifts to the Ethereal Plane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith can use its Eye Bleed and makes two mirror shard attacks.

action.name: Mirror Shard
entries: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (4d6+5) slashing damage.

action.name: Eye Bleed
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith's eyes, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 22 (4d10) necrotic damage and be permanently blinded.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: The wraith flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Prison of Mirrors (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Every creature the wraith can see within 30 feet of a mirror at least 4 feet tall must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be magically shifted to the wraith's demiplane.

legendary.name: Death Omen (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target is affected as if by the enemies abound spell, seeing all creatures as threatening undead. In addition, the target dies if it drops to 0 hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

monster.name: Noonwraith

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Midday Dance
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wraith that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed, joining the wraith in its maddening dance. The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the noonwraith's Midday Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Moonlight Sensitivity
entries: At night, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 28 (5d8+5) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken and the wraith regains hit points equal to that amount.This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Searing Heat (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wraith wraps heat and dust around her. Every creature within 20 feet of the wraith must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save and being blinded until the end of their next turn. Creatures take half as much damage on a successful saving throw and are not blinded.

monster.name: Nightwraith

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Moonlight Dance
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the wraith that can see it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed, joining the wraith in its maddening dance. The creature is free from the enchantment if it takes any damage. Each hour passed dancing, the creature gains one level of exhaustion. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw each hour, with disadvantage if the wraith is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the nightwraith's Moonlight Dance for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The wraith takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 28 (5d8+5) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Deathly Projection (2/Day)
entries: The wraith creates 3 (1d4+1) duplicates specter of itself that appear in an unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of it. It can also turn invisible until it attacks, either before or after it creates the specters. The wraith regains hit points equal to the damage inflicted by the specters.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

trait.name: Etherealness
entries: The wraith enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa with a bonus action. The wraith is invisible while on the Border Ethereal and it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Shadow Being
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the wraith has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, one with its sapping tether and two with its shadow claws.

action.name: Shadow Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d8+6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Sapping Tether
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 17 (2d10+6) psychic damage and the target's Wisdom score is reduced by 1d6. The target gains a hym's indefinite madness if this reduces its Wisdom to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

legendary.name: Shadow Step
entries: The wraith magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness. It then has advantage on the next melee attack before the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Torment (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets on creatures with hym's indefinite madness that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw, taking 33 (6d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Rip Shadow (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to the wraith and within 30 feet of it. If the target fails a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the wraith's commands, acting on the initiative count of the wraith. A greater restoration spell or a remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wraith's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The wraith can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Cenokian Wraith
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Faces of Terror
entries: Any creature who targets the wraith with an attack or a harmful spell must first succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the creature's next turn.

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The wraith can't enter a residence if its owner has marked the main door with lamb's blood.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three spectral claw attacks.

action.name: Spectral Claw
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8+6) necrotic damage, plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

action.name: Absorb Soul
entries: The wraith chooses a living humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within 5 feet of it. The target's soul is magically trapped inside the wraith, the wraith regains 20 hit points, immediately recharges Death Grasp, and gains an additional action on its next turn. While the soul is trapped, the target's body and all the equipment it is carrying cease to exist. The soul is freed if the wraith drops to 0 hit points, or the wraith frees it as an action, at which point the target's body reforms in an unoccupied space nearest to the wraith and in the same state as when it was trapped.

action.name: Death Grasp (Recharges 5-6)
entries: The wraith reaches into the body of a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 47 (6d8+20) necrotic damage. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Death Mark
entries: The wraith targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed until the end of the wraith's next turn. Until the curse ends, the target is vulnerable to necrotic damage and can't regain hit points.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The wraith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Insanity (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith targets one frightened creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the wraith, it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 16 (3d10) psychic damage and gain a random form of short-term madness (roll on the Short-Term Madness table in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) for 1 minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the madness.

monster.name: Arch-Wraith
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life, telepathy limitless in its Domain of Dread

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The wraith can magically sense the presence of living creatures anywhere in its Domain of Dread. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The wraith is immune to effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes three attacks, only one of which can be a Grave's Touch attack.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 32 (5d8+10) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction last until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Grave's Touch
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 37 (5d10+10) cold damage and the target's must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, becoming petrified, encased in ice, until the end of its next turn on a failure.

action.name: Ray of Decay
entries: Ranged Spell Attack: {@hit +14} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Ray of Decay
entries: The wraith uses its Ray of Decay.

legendary.name: Whirlwind (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith turns into a frigid whirlwind, draining away the life of nearby creatures. All creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) cold damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage on a failure, or half as much damage on a success.

legendary.name: Dead Silence (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The arch-wraith can rob a creature within 120 feet of it from its senses, leaving it in pitch-black darkness. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw, becoming blinded and deafened on failure for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Dolgotha
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Acid Blood
entries: A creature that hits the dolgotha with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

trait.name: Acid Fog
entries: A 20-foot-radius sphere of acid fog surrounds the dolgotha. The fog spreads around corners. Its area is heavily obscured. When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 23 (5d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Strong wind disperses the fog for{@dice  1d4 }turns before it returns.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dolgotha can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fog Crawler
entries: While in the fog, The dolgotha can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns and has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dolgotha makes three melee attacks; one with its beak and two with its chelipeds.

action.name: Beak
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +14} to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit 27 (4d8+9) piercing damage.

action.name: Chelipeds
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +14} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit 19 (3d6+9) piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the dolgotha jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a DC 19 Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target' s choice) or be knocked prone and take 27 (4d8+9) bludgeoning damage plus 27 (4d8+9) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage , isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of the dolgotha's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls prone in the dolgotha's space.

action.name: Corrosive Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The dolgotha exhales acid in 60-foot cone. Each creature in that cone must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 (12d8) acid damage on a failed save, and 23 (5d8) acid damage at the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much of the initial damage and no damage at the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Dluur
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dluur can breathe air and water.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the dluur remains motionless in water under the surface, it is indistinguishable from a normal patch of lure weed.

trait.name: Lure
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the dluur and can see the dluur's illicium, the dluur can force the creature to make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw if the dluur isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed until the end of its next turn. While charmed, the creature must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as close as its speed allows toward the dluur. The effect ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dluur makes two claws attacks. It can use Acid Spit in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: Range Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. Hit 10 (3d6) acid damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 3 (1d6) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

reaction.name: Psychic Assault
entries: When a creature the dluur can see starts its turn charmed within 60 feet of the aberration, the dluur can attack its mind with psychic powers. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and be stunned until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The uhogguath can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the uhogguath can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The uhogguath can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Ethereal Web
entries: The ground in a 30-foot radius around the uhogguath is covered in semi-solid ethereal webs, making the area difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be restrained by the ethereal web until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uhogguath makes two melee attacks; one with its bite and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 8 (1d10+3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 9 (2d8) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 14) and must succeed on a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw or be stunned until this grapple ends.

action.name: Drain Intellect (Recharge 4-6)
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the uhogguath. Hit: 21 (6d6) psychic damage and the target must make a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Intelligence and Charisma scores become 1. The creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way. The creature can, however, identify its friends, follow them, and even protect them. At the end of a long rest, the creature can repeat its saving throw against this effect, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration spell cast on the target also ends the effect.

monster.name: Warp Spawn
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the spawn and can see it, the spawn can force the creature to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw if the spawn isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of of its turns to remove the madness. A creature which already has a short term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw against this spawn's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Warp Form
entries: The warp spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Whenever the spawn starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spawn is incapacitated for one round as its thrashes between nightmarish forms.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The warp spawn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warp spawn uses its Mutated Beyond Reason and makes three melee attacks; one with its bite, one with its claws and one with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10+5) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8+5) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d6+5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 15).

action.name: Mutated Beyond Reason
entries: The warp spawn mutates and selects one of the options below.
1. Deadly Mutation. The spawn moves from its speed and makes a tentacle attack.

2. Eldritch Burst. Great bolts of eldritch energy are arcing out of the warp spawn. A line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 10 (3d6) lightning damage and 10 (3d6) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
3. Regeneration. The warp spawn regains 10 hit points.

reaction.name: Mask of Insanity
entries: When a creature the spawn can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the aberration, the spawn can wrap its mind in psychic terror. If the creature can see the spawn, it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of its turn.

monster.name: Balewing
monster.languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Otherworldly Presence
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the balewing and can see it, the balewing can force the creature to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw if the balewing isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature acquires a short term madness randomly determined which lasts for 1 minute. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of of its turns to remove the madness. A creature which already has a short term madness, is immune to psychic damage, or which has succeeded on a saving throw against this balewing's Otherworldly Presence in the last 24 hours is immune.

trait.name: Magic Attack
entries: The balewing's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balewing has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balewing makes four melee attacks; one with its bite and three with its tendrils. It can use Hurl Balefire in place of any melee attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 29 (4d10+7) piercing damage.

action.name: Hurl Balefire
entries: Ranged Spell Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) fire damage and 7 (2d6) acid damage. This damage ignores resistance and immunity.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit 10 (3d6) acid damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) acid damage on a failure or ending the recurring acid damage on a success. A lesser restoration spell cast on the target also ends the recurring acid damage.

action.name: Eldritch Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The balewing exhales arcs of energy in an 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (5d10) lightning damage and 28 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, as per the disintegrate spell.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: All zombies within 5 miles of the shambling lord are tied into an instinctive hive mind, linked to the lord. Within the range of the telepathic bond, the shambling lord can see through the eyes of any zombie, hear what it hears and speak through it. It can cast spells as though it were in the zombie's space, and can mentally command any zombie within reach (if it controls multiple creatures, it can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shambling lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The zombie regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the zombie takes radiant damage or a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of the zombie's next turn. The shambling lord is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Well of Knowledge
entries: The shambling lord can recollect all the knowledges and memories stored in the collective hive mind of its hordes or the brains it devoured. It has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom skill checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambling lord uses its Shambling Hordes feature, if available, and makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d6+4) piercing damage 17 (5d6) necrotic damage

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Psychic Assault
entries: The shambling lord magically assault the mind of three targets it can see within 90 feet of it. A target must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also stunned until the end of the zombie's next turn.

action.name: Shambling Hordes (recharge 5-6)
entries: The shambling lord can summon one horde of zombies, a summoned horde appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the shambling lord, acting as an ally. It remains for l minute, until it or the shambling lord dies, or until the shambling lord dismisses it as an action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The shambling lord's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 16). The zombie can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Ravenous Zombie
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The zombie has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Herald of Decay
entries: All food and liquid within 60 feet of the zombie spoils instantly. Rations turn bad, meat rots, bread becomes stale and water becomes unsafe to drink. Small nonmagical plants wither and die, while trees become sick and start to rot. Perishables protected by air-sealed containers are unaffected.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Voracious Aura
entries: Any living creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the zombie or enters the affected area for the first time on a turn must succeed a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6), and the zombie regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two unarmed strike attacks and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8+4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the zombie can grapple the target (escape DC 14).

action.name: Devour
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature that is grappled by the zombie, incapacitated or restrained. Hit: 22 (4d8+4) piercing damage. A creature taking damage from the attack suffers from a lingering injury (p.272 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

monster.name: Horde Of Zombies
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Plagued
entries: When the swarm hits with an attack, it deals an extra 10 (3d6) necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horde uses its pull under ability if able, then uses its gnaw and claw attack.

Gnaw and Claw. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Pull Under
entries: The horde attempts to envelope a creature within its space. The target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and considered grappled (escape DC 13) as they are pinned to the ground under a sea of zombies. This ability can only be used if the horde is above half of its maximum hit points.

monster.name: Feral Zombie
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the zombie can move up to half its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage.

monster.name: Bloated Zombie
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the zombie is destroyed, it explodes in a burst of acid and guts. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) acid damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

action.name: Spew Bile (recharge 5-6)
entries: The zombie spews bile in 15-foot line. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
